name: places/ChIJAcpCFvBZwokRdA1UO2M-MIo
adrFormatAddress: 174 8th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

editorialSummary.text: Tropical takes on classic cocktails are paired with Southeast Asian & California-influenced fare.

originalText.text: Got there at 4:30 and there and there were already a fee people there. The happy hour menu is nice but we decided to just stick to the regular menu, the fries were nice with lemon, parmesan, red peppers and a spicy aioli, the “I wanna be adored” had a wonderful rose flavor, the old fashioned was great and the black velvet was great. The fried chicken was great.

text.text: Got there at 4:30 and there and there were already a fee people there. The happy hour menu is nice but we decided to just stick to the regular menu, the fries were nice with lemon, parmesan, red peppers and a spicy aioli, the “I wanna be adored” had a wonderful rose flavor, the old fashioned was great and the black velvet was great. The fried chicken was great.

originalText.text:
Such a fun place with zero proof drinks and gluten free food options!! This place checked off ALL the boxes and was exactly what we were looking for!!

Super fun vibe with beautiful plants, decor, candles, and a great place to catch up with friends!

All the staff was extremely friendly, personable, and knowledgeable about the menu.

I went with 1 other person and we tried their zero proof cocktails. Two of the three were wonderful. One was a little lack luster (said there was elderflower but we didn’t taste it and it felt like a fancy lemonade).

The menu was clearly marked with GF for all the gluten free options! We got the fries even through they weren’t marked GF. They use a shared fryer, so decide for yourself.

All in all, such a wonderful experience and I’ll be recommending to everyone!!

originalText.text: Jungle Bird is a cute spot for cocktails and small bites if you are hungry. The food was surprisingly good but small portions! The cocktails were also very creative and strong!

text.text: Jungle Bird is a cute spot for cocktails and small bites if you are hungry. The food was surprisingly good but small portions! The cocktails were also very creative and strong!

originalText.text:
Jungle Bird serves craft cocktails in a much more casual atmosphere than some is the city’s more cloistered speakeasies — and that’s a great thing. The cocktails on the menu may have curious and adventurous ingredients and guffaw-inducing names (“I’m Old Fashioned”, “Cigarettes and Sex”), but each one we tried was strikingly well-balanced and nicely presented. The food is Asian fusion, which would seem an odd fit and a turn-off — except that it was really good. The happy hour chicken and ginger pan-fried dumplings were exceptional, and the Thai-chili deep-fried chickpeas were addictive.

Jingle Bird is a fantastic place to meet up after work in whatever you’re wearing. Just make a reservation and don’t plan to loiter. They firmly reminded us to leave once our two-hour reservation allotment ended. But that’s just the price for more democratic access to a truly well-executed bar.

The food is Asian fusion, which would seem an odd fit and a turn-off — except that it was really good. The happy hour chicken and ginger pan-fried dumplings were exceptional, and the Thai-chili deep-fried chickpeas were addictive.

originalText.text: Cannot say enough great things about Jungle Bird! We went earlier in the night on NYE and sat at the bar for some cocktails and snacks - our drinks were outstanding and the food was good too. The fried garlic on top of the fries stole the show for me, ha! The service was attentive but not overbearing. Perfect night all around. I can't wait to come back!
